required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anterior Tibial Subluxation in the Setting of ACL-injury and After ACL Reconstruction
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Study of Anterior Tibial Subluxation in the Setting of Anterior Cruciate Ligament Injury and After Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction

brief_summary.textblock: To identify the related factors for anterior tibial subluxation (ATS) on anterior cruciate ligament-injured MRI images.

detailed_description.textblock: Demographic data and MRI images of anterior cruciate ligament-injured patients were retrospectively analyzed. Anterior tibial subluxation was measured and factors were examined via univariate and multivariate analysis.

primary_outcome.description: Anterior tibial subluxation was measured preoperatively.

intervention.intervention_name: Demographic data and MRI images were extracted and analyzed
intervention.description: Demographic data and MRI images were extracted and analyzed. Related factors for anterior tibial subluxation were examined in anterior cruciate ligament-injured patients.

study_pop.textblock: ACL-injured patients that had suffered from ACL injury and underwent primary ACL reconstruction between January 1, 2013 and December 31, 2015.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed anterior cruciate ligament injuries
- Available preoperative MRI images at our hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients were excluded in the case of under 18 years of age
- Bilateral anterior cruciate ligament injuries
- Concomitant posterior cruciate ligament injuries
- Concomitant collateral ligament injuries
- No access to the preoperative MRI scan at our hospital
